verses.translation: By those [angels] lined up in rows,
and those who drive [the clouds],
and those who recite Allah’s words[1],
indeed, your God is One,

verses.arabic_text: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ
verses.translation: Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, and Lord of the points of sunrise.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلۡكَوَاكِبِ
verses.translation: We have adorned the sky with the beauty of the stars,
and for safeguarding it against every rebellious devil,

verses.arabic_text: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ وَيُقۡذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٖ
verses.translation: so that they cannot eavesdrop on the highest assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side[2]
to repel them; and for them there will be a perpetual punishment,

verses.arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنۡ خَطِفَ ٱلۡخَطۡفَةَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٞ ثَاقِبٞ
verses.translation: except who stealthily snatches away some words, he will be pursued by a piercing flame.

verses.arabic_text: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَهُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَم مَّنۡ خَلَقۡنَآۚ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُم مِّن طِينٖ لَّازِبِۭ
verses.translation: So ask them, “Are they more difficult to create or other things We created? We created them[3] from sticky clay.
Rather you are astonished, while they ridicule it,
and when they are reminded, they pay no heed,
and when they see a sign, they ridicule it,

verses.arabic_text: وَقَالُوٓاْ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: and they say, “This is nothing but clear magic.

verses.arabic_text: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ
verses.translation: Is it that when we are dead and become dust and bones, will we really be raised up again,
and our forefathers too?”
Say, “Yes, and you will be disgraced.”

verses.arabic_text: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ فَإِذَا هُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
verses.translation: It will only be a single Blast[4], and at once they will be looking around.
They will say, “Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!”

verses.arabic_text: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
verses.translation: [They will be told], “This is the Day of Decision that you used to deny.”

verses.arabic_text: ۞ ٱحۡشُرُواْ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ وَأَزۡوَٰجَهُمۡ وَمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡبُدُونَ
verses.translation: [The angels will be told], “Gather all those who did wrong and their fellows[5], and whatever they used to worship

verses.arabic_text: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهۡدُوهُمۡ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: besides Allah, and lead them to the way of Hell,
and stop them, for they are to be questioned.”
[They will be asked], “What is the matter with you, that you no longer help one another?”
Rather on that Day they will surrender completely.
They will turn to one another, reproaching one another.

verses.arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَأۡتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
verses.translation: [The followers] will say, “It was you who used to delude us from the right way[6].”
[The misleaders] will say, “Rather, you yourselves were not believers,

verses.arabic_text: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيۡكُم مِّن سُلۡطَٰنِۭۖ بَلۡ كُنتُمۡ قَوۡمٗا طَٰغِينَ
verses.translation: and We had no power over you, rather you yourselves were a transgressing people.

verses.arabic_text: فَحَقَّ عَلَيۡنَا قَوۡلُ رَبِّنَآۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
verses.translation: Now the punishment of our Lord has come true against us; we will surely taste it.
We did misguide you, for we ourselves were misguided”.
On that Day they will all share in the punishment.
This is how We deal with the wicked,

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوٓاْ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسۡتَكۡبِرُونَ
verses.translation: for whenever it was said to them, “None has the right to be worshiped except Allah,” they became arrogant,

verses.arabic_text: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓاْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٖ مَّجۡنُونِۭ
verses.translation: and said, “Are we going to abandon our gods for a mad poet[7]?”
Rather, he came with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
You will surely taste the painful punishment,

verses.arabic_text: وَمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
verses.translation: and you will only be recompensed for what you used to do,
except the chosen slaves of Allah.
They will have a known provision,
fruits[8]; and they will be honored
in Gardens of Bliss,
facing one another[9] on couches.
They will be served with a cup of wine from a flowing stream,
white and delicious for those who drink.

verses.arabic_text: لَا فِيهَا غَوۡلٞ وَلَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا يُنزَفُونَ
verses.translation: It will cause no harm, nor will they be intoxicated by it,
and with them will be maidens of modest gaze[10] and beautiful eyes,
as if they were well-protected eggs[11].
Then they will turn to one another asking[12].

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ قَآئِلٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٞ
verses.translation: One of them will say, “I had a close friend [in the world]
who used to say[13], ‘Are you one of those who believe

verses.arabic_text: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
verses.translation: that when we die and become dust and bones, shall we be brought for judgment?’”
He will say[14], “Do you wish to see [his fate]?”
So he will look down and see him[15] in the midst of the Blazing Fire.
He will say, “By Allah, you were about to ruin me.

verses.arabic_text: وَلَوۡلَا نِعۡمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُحۡضَرِينَ
verses.translation: Were it not for the grace of my Lord, I would have been among those who are brought [to Hell].”
[He will say to his fellow believers], “Are we not going to die anymore,

verses.arabic_text: إِلَّا مَوۡتَتَنَا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.translation: except for our first death, nor are we going to be punished?”
This is indeed the supreme triumph!
For such [reward] let the workers work.

verses.arabic_text: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيۡرٞ نُّزُلًا أَمۡ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
verses.translation: Is this a better accommodation or the tree of Zaqqūm[16]?[17]
We have made it a trial for the wrongdoers.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٞ تَخۡرُجُ فِيٓ أَصۡلِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: It is a tree that grows in the bottom of the Blazing Fire;
its fruits are like heads of devils.

verses.arabic_text: فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَأٓكِلُونَ مِنۡهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ
verses.translation: They will certainly eat from it, filling their bellies.

verses.arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا لَشَوۡبٗا مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ
verses.translation: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture of scalding water,
then their final return will be to the Blazing Fire.
For they found their forefathers astray,
so they rushed to follow in their footsteps.
Indeed, most of the earlier people went astray before them,
even though We sent among them warners.
Then see how was the end of those who were warned,
except the chosen slaves of Allah.
Indeed, Noah called upon Us; how excellent are We at responding!
And We saved him and his household[18] from the great distress,
and made his offspring[19] the only survivors,
and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
“Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.”
This is how We reward those who do good.
He was one of Our believing slaves.
Then we drowned the others.
Indeed, Abraham was one of those who followed his way.
When he came to his Lord with a sound heart,

verses.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
verses.translation: and said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping?
Is it false gods that you seek other than Allah?
Then what do you think of the Lord of the worlds?”
He then cast a glance at the stars[20],
and said, “I am sick[21].”
So they went away from him and left.

verses.arabic_text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمۡ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
verses.translation: Then he turned to their gods and said, “Why do you not eat[22]?
What is wrong with you that you do not speak?”
Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand.
Then his people came rushing towards him.
He said, “Do you worship what you yourselves carve,
when it is Allah Who created you and all what you do?”

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ ٱبۡنُواْ لَهُۥ بُنۡيَٰنٗا فَأَلۡقُوهُ فِي ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: They said, “Build a pyre for him and throw him into the blazing fire.”
They contrived a plan against him, but We made them the lowest.

verses.arabic_text: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ
verses.translation: He said, “I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.
My Lord, grant me righteous offspring.”
So We gave him glad tidings of a forbearing boy[23].

verses.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعۡيَ قَالَ يَٰبُنَيَّ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰ فِي ٱلۡمَنَامِ أَنِّيٓ أَذۡبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا تَرَىٰۚ قَالَ يَٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفۡعَلۡ مَا تُؤۡمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِيٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
verses.translation: Then when he reached the age where he could work with him, Abraham said, “O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice you. What do you think?” He said, “O my dear father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, one of the steadfast.”
When they both submitted [to Allah’s command] and Abraham laid him on his forehead,
and We called out to him, “O Abraham,

verses.arabic_text: قَدۡ صَدَّقۡتَ ٱلرُّءۡيَآۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ
verses.translation: You have fulfilled the dream.” This is how We reward those who do good.
This was indeed a revealing test.
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice[24],
and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
“Peace be upon Abraham.”
This is how We reward those who do good.
He was one of Our believing slaves.
And We gave him the glad tidings of Isaac[25], a prophet, and one of the righteous.

verses.arabic_text: وَبَٰرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسۡحَٰقَۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحۡسِنٞ وَظَالِمٞ لِّنَفۡسِهِۦ مُبِينٞ
verses.translation: We blessed him[26] and Isaac, but among their offspring were some who did good and some who clearly wronged themselves.
Indeed, We bestowed Our favor upon Moses and Aaron,
and We saved them and their people from the great distress[27],
and We helped them, so they were victorious,
and We gave them both the clear Scripture,
and guided them to the straight path;
and We left for them [a favorable mention] among later generations:
“Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.”
This is how We reward those who do good.
They were truly of Our believing slaves.
Elijah was indeed one of the messengers.
When he said to his people: “Do you not fear Allah?
Do you call upon Ba‘l[28] and ignore the Best of the Creators,
Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”
But they rejected him, so they will surely be brought [for punishment],
except the chosen slaves of Allah.
And We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
“Peace be upon Elias.”
This is how We reward those who do good.
He was one of Our believing slaves.
Lot was indeed one of the messengers.
When We saved him and all of his household,
except an old woman[29] who was among those who stayed behind.
Then We destroyed the rest.
You [Makkans] pass by their ruins by day
and by night. Do you still not understand?
Jonah was indeed one of the messengers.
When he fled to the fully laden ship,
then he cast lots[30] with them, but was among those who lost.
The whale then swallowed him while he was blameworthy[31].
Were it not for the fact that he was one of those who glorify Allah,

verses.arabic_text: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطۡنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ
verses.translation: he would have stayed in its belly until the Day of Resurrection[32].
But We cast him ashore on a barren land while he was ill,
and caused a gourd vine[33] to grow over him.

verses.arabic_text: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِاْئَةِ أَلۡفٍ أَوۡ يَزِيدُونَ
verses.translation: We sent him[34] to one hundred thousand people or more,
and they believed, so We let them enjoy for a while.
So ask them, “Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?”[35]

verses.arabic_text: أَمۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَٰثٗا وَهُمۡ شَٰهِدُونَ
verses.translation: Or did We create the angels as females while they were watching?
No indeed, it is one of their fabrications when they say,
“Allah has children,” and they are truly liars.
Did He choose daughters over sons[36]?
What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
Will you not then take heed?
Do you have any compelling proof?
Then bring your scripture, if you are truthful.

verses.arabic_text: وَجَعَلُواْ بَيۡنَهُۥ وَبَيۡنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ نَسَبٗاۚ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمَتِ ٱلۡجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ
verses.translation: They claim that there is a kinship between Him and the jinn[37], when the jinn themselves know that such people will surely be brought [for punishment].
Glorified is Allah far above what they ascribe [to Him].
But not the chosen slaves of Allah[38].
So you and whatever you worship
none of you can lure anyone away from Him,
except those who are destined to burn in the Blazing Fire[39].

verses.arabic_text: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
verses.translation: [The angels say][40], “There is none among us but has a known station[41]:
We are indeed those who stand lined up in rows,
and we are indeed those who glorify Allah.”
And [the pagans] used to say[42],

verses.arabic_text: لَوۡ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكۡرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: “If only we had a scripture[43] like the previous people,
we would have surely been true slaves of Allah.”
But they rejected it[44]; soon they will come to know.
Our Word has already been given to Our slaves, the messengers,
that it is surely they who will be given victory,
and that Our soldiers will surely be the victors.
So turn away from them for a while.
Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].
Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?

verses.arabic_text: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمۡ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ
verses.translation: When it[45] descends on their courtyard, how terrible will be the morning of those who were warned!
And turn away from them for a while.
Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].

verses.arabic_text: سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلۡعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.translation: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, far above what they ascribe [to Him],
and peace be upon the messengers,
and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
